data.title: Billy Wilder: About Film Noir
data.meta_description: Billy Wilder: About Film Noir. An interview by Robert Porfirio. An excerpt from Film Noir Reader 3.
data.text:
"A man who makes movies and certainly somebody like myself that makes all kinds of movies, works in different styles. I don't make only one kind of movie, like say Hitchcock. Or like Minnelli, doing the great Metro musicals. As a picture-maker, and I think most of us are this way, I am not aware of patterns. We're not aware that 'This picture will be in this genre.' It comes naturally, just the way you do your handwriting." An excerpt from Film Noir Reader 3 (November 2001, Limelight Editions).

Go to the interview
